value.title: Nvidia’s Rubin Chips on Track, CEO Huang Says
value.content: Nvidia Corp.’s highly anticipated Rubin data center processors are in production and customers will soon be able to try out the technology, according to Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang. Meanwhile, Advanced Micro Devices Inc. announced a new chip for corporate data center use and talked up the attributes of a future generation of products for that market. Bloomberg Intelligence’s Masahiro Wakasugi breaks down the situation.

value.title: AMD's Su Unveils New Tech, Talks Up AI Demand
value.content: Analyst on AMD's New Tech, AI Demand DEK: Advanced Micro Devices CEO Lisa Su touted the attributes of a future generation of products, saying the pace of AI innovation has been incredible. Constellation Research founder Ray Wang provides context. (Source: Bloomberg)

value.title: Legal AI Platform Legora Expands Into Australia
value.content:
As investors pile into the AI boom, Australia is attracting massive bets from global tech firms. 
Legora, a Swedish AI startup, aims to tackle legal grunt work by automating tasks such as contract review and due diligence. Heather Paterson, the company's lead for Asia Pacific and Japan, discusses the expansion into the Australian market and the adoption of AI for legal tasks on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade".  (Source: Bloomberg)

value.title: Buyout Firm Hg Is Nearing a Deal to Take OneStream Private
value.content: Buyout firm Hg Capital is in advanced talks to acquire financial software maker OneStream Inc., according to people familiar with the matter.

value.title: AMD Unveils New Chip For Corporate Data Centers, Talks Up Demand
value.content: Advanced Micro Devices Inc., aiming to make a dent in Nvidia Corp.’s stranglehold on the AI hardware market, announced a new chip for corporate data center use and talked up the attributes of a future generation of products for that market.

value.title: TheraVectys Is Said to Mull Hong Kong IPO in Rare Move for Non-Chinese Biotech Firm
value.content: TheraVectys SA is considering an initial public offering in Hong Kong, according to people familiar with the matter, a rare move for a non-Chinese biotech firm despite a wave of listings in the Asian financial hub.

value.title: Nvidia CEO Says Rubin Chips Are on Track, Demand Is Strong
value.content: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang said that the company’s highly anticipated Rubin data center processors are in production and customers will soon be able to try out the technology.

value.title: Nvidia CEO says Rubin in Production, Keynote Falls Flat
value.content:
Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says their highly anticipated new Vera Rubin systems are nearing release this year. Speaking at CES in Las Vegas, Huang said customers will soon be able to try out the technology, helping speed AI development. Nvidia share's didn't react much to the presentation. Bloomberg Technology anchor Ed Ludlow breaks down Huang's keynote on 'Bloomberg: The Asia Trade.'

 (Source: Bloomberg)

value.title: Nvidia Sees Strong Chinese Demand for H200, Has Enough Supply
value.content: Nvidia Corp. said it has seen strong demand from customers in China for the H200 chip that the Trump administration has said it will consider letting the chipmaker ship to that country.

value.title: British CFOs Grow More Optimistic That AI Will Boost Their Firms
value.content: More than half of British companies’ finance chiefs expect artificial intelligence to deliver a growth boost, in a sign of rising optimism over the technology’s potential to transform the economy.

value.title: Intel Shows Off New Computers That Are Central to Comeback Bid
value.content: Intel Corp. showed off laptop computers based on processors with a new design, part of the chipmaker’s effort to make its products competitive again.

value.title: Data Centers Added $6.5 Billion to Big US Grid’s Power Cost
value.content: Data centers tied to the biggest US grid just tacked on another $6.5 billion to the cost of procuring power supplies, adding to concerns the artificial intelligence boom is worsening energy inflation.

value.title: Columbia's Tim Wu on Monopoly Concerns ‘Outside Tech'
value.content: Tim Wu, Columbia Law professor and former White House technology adviser, says policymakers need to ensure big tech does not extract too much from the economy. He tells Romaine Bostick and Katie Greifeld on “The Close” that it may be time to push back on big tech’s power. (Source: Bloomberg)

value.title: Kodiak AI CEO on Driverless Truck Partnership With Bosch
value.content: Don Burnette, Kodiak Founder and CEO, says the company is now in production with driverless systems operating safely. He tells Romaine Bostick and Katie Greifeld on “The Close” that adoption is expected to accelerate as customers grow more comfortable with autonomous trucking. (Source: Bloomberg)

value.title: Nvidia CEO Huang Says New Vera Rubin Design Is in Full Production
value.content: "The race is on for AI," Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says during his presentation at the CES trade show in Las Vegas. (Source: Bloomberg)

value.title: Dell Brings Back XPS Laptops As Top Executive Says PC Unit Got ‘Off Course’
value.content: Dell Technologies Inc. is bringing back its well-regarded XPS laptop brand after discontinuing it last year, as a top executive said the PC business had “gotten a bit off course.”

value.title: AI Video Generation Leads China’s Kuaishou to 84% Stock Surge
value.content: Few major companies have tried to pull off a pivot to AI as swiftly as Kuaishou Technology.

value.title: Nvidia CEO Huang Announces New AI Tools for Autonomous Vehicles
value.content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang announces a group of AI models and tools designed to speed the development of autonomous vehicles during his presentation at the CES trade show in Las Vegas. The free offering is aimed at creating vehicles that can think their way out of unexpected situations, such as a traffic-light outage. (Source: Bloomberg)

value.title: Vistra Buying US Gas-Power Fleet for $4 Billion to Deepen AI Bet
value.content: Vistra Corp. agreed to pay roughly $4 billion for 10 natural gas-fired power plants in the US Northeast and Texas to expand the electricity supplier’s generation capacity in fast-growing energy markets.
